title.native: ワンダーエッグ・プライオリティ

description:
This is the story of Ai, an introverted girl whose fate is forever changed when she acquires a mysterious “Wonder Egg” from a deserted arcade. That night, her dreams blend into reality, and as other girls obtain their own Wonder Eggs, Ai discovers new friends—and the magic within herself.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: วันเดอร์เอ็ก ไพรออริตี

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Afterlife
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the afterlife.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

title.native: ワンダーエッグ・プライオリティ 特別編

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/haaagin) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/87_hagi)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). Debuted as a character designer on [Wonder Egg Priority](https://anilist.co/anime/124845/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/huusun)

Originating from Xebec. Although now is freelancer, currently engaged in training young directors for [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/) as of May 2024. Debuted as a director on [Wonder Egg Priority](https://anilist.co/anime/124845/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/haaagin) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/87_hagi)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). Debuted as a character designer on [Wonder Egg Priority](https://anilist.co/anime/124845/).

Shinji Nojima is a screenwriter for Japanese TV dramas. He debuted in 1988 as a writer on _Kimi no Uso wo Tsuita_ (You Lied) with no professional training for his work. In 1991, he achieved fame from his work on _Hyakuikkaime no Puropozu_ (101 Proposals).

He started writing scripts in the anime industry in 2021, with Wonder Egg Priority as his first hit. He has also written stories for several manga.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/88151202)

Nobuhiro Nakayama is a producer belonging to [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Formerly [Geneon Universal Entertainment](https://anilist.co/studio/31/), then [Warner Bros.](https://anilist.co/studio/415/)

Shinji Nojima is a screenwriter for Japanese TV dramas. He debuted in 1988 as a writer on _Kimi no Uso wo Tsuita_ (You Lied) with no professional training for his work. In 1991, he achieved fame from his work on _Hyakuikkaime no Puropozu_ (101 Proposals).

He started writing scripts in the anime industry in 2021, with Wonder Egg Priority as his first hit. He has also written stories for several manga.
Director of the Finishing Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/4006951) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/micromicrophone/)

A Japanese musician, lyricist, composer, arranger and the bandmaster of [Clammbon](https://anilist.co/staff/114171/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/huusun)

Originating from Xebec. Although now is freelancer, currently engaged in training young directors for [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/) as of May 2024. Debuted as a director on [Wonder Egg Priority](https://anilist.co/anime/124845/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/haaagin) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/87_hagi)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). Debuted as a character designer on [Wonder Egg Priority](https://anilist.co/anime/124845/).
